subject: Sales
title: The Uncomfortable Question
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Uncomfortable Question.

hook.text: The seller asks: 'What happens to your career if this project fails?' The entire room shifts.

buildup.text: Uncomfortable questions reach the emotional core of a decision. They're risky but deeply revealing.

discovery.text: When a buyer faces real consequences, urgency becomes personal. The problem stops being theoretical.

twist.text: Ask too bluntly and you offend. The key is framing with genuine concern, not interrogation.

climax.text: One well-placed uncomfortable question can achieve more than twenty safe ones. Timing is everything.

punchline.text: The question that makes them pause is the one that matters.

quiz.question: When should uncomfortable questions be used in sales?
options: At high-stakes moments, framed with genuine concern
